titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Fayette Hewitt Letters, 1894
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: A letter of Fayette Hewitt to Thomas D. Osborne concerning the return of bodies of soldiers killed in various battles, including Chickamauga; and a picture and biographical sketch of Hewitt.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Fayette Hewitt letters, 1894, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Fayette Hewitt was a Confederate Army officer from Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: A letter of Fayette Hewitt to Thomas D. Osborne concerning the return of bodies of soldiers killed in various battles, including Chickamauga; and a picture and biographical sketch of Hewitt.

controlaccess.subject: Soldiers' bodies, Disposition of -- History -- 19th century
Chickamauga, Battle of, Ga., 1863
